clinical_study.official_title: Pilot RCT to Evaluate the Effects of a Trust-Building Depression Management Intervention on Moderate Depressive Symptoms in Low-Income Adolescents

collaborator.agency: National Institute on Minority Health and Health Disparities (NIMHD)

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the effectiveness of a novel depression management intervention in adolescents with depression. Half of participants will receive a traditional depression management intervention, wile the other half will receive the novel depression management intervention.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline to 3 months and 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Change in total summed score on PHQ-9. Higher scores indicate greater depressive symptoms. Range is 0-27.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline to 3 monhts and 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in total summed and transformed score on the Youth Quality of Life scale. The response scale ranges from 0 = not at all to 10 = a great deal or completely. The scores are summed and then transformed to a 0 to 100 scale, with a higher score representing a higher quality of life.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline to 3 months and 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in mean score of all items in each subscale of the Adolescent Sleep Hygiene Scale. Higher scores indicate better sleep hygiene. Range is 1-6.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adolescent Lifestyle Questionnaire Stress management subscale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline to 3 months and 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in total summed score on stress management sub-scale of the Adolescent Lifestyle Questionnaire. Higher scores indicate better stress management. Range is 4-20.

secondary_outcome.measure: Extent of Medication Non-Adherence scale (Medication adherence)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline to 3 months and 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in total summed score on the Extent of Medication Non-Adherence scale. Higher scores indicate greater levels of nonadherence. Range is 3-15.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline to 3 months and 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in total summed score on Hill-Bone Compliance Scale. Range is 9-36, with lower scores indicating greater appointment keeping.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Lives in the Cleveland metro area
- Ages 14-17 years old
- Reports moderate depressive symptoms
- Able to read, speak, and understand the English language
Exclusion Criteria:
- Current suicide risk
- Diagnosis with bipolar disorder, schizophrenia, or a personality disorder
- Severe behavioral problems that preclude group participation (as reported by parent)
- Family plans to move from the region within 6 months

patient_data.ipd_description: De-identified data will be shared for further analysis after main results are published.
